---

Opa was an Uruguayan band of the 70's. Founded in the United States by Ringo Thielman, Hugo and Osvaldo Fattoruso that fused Jazz, Candombe and Rock.

History:

Hugo and Osvaldo Fattoruso were members of the Shakers, to separate this band, Ringo Thielmann (former band member) calls from the U.S. to form a new band. They play for three years in the trio format and contact with Airto Moreira, who are touring in 1973 and recorded the album Fingers. The disc name was inspired by the theme Fingers Ruben Rada, which was previously recorded by his band Totem, this subject was included on the disc. Later this band split, returning to the original trio act Opa.


Albums:

- Back Home (Flac)

- Goldenwings, Magic Time (Flac)

- Opa en vivo 87' & rarities (Flac)
